intro: Lechleria, commonly known as the golden cup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble small cups, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. Lechleria has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological diversity.
